properties.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 13 at 3:31AM PST until January 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
...EXTENDED PERIOD OF WINTER WEATHER CONTINUES...

.Two more systems will impact the region through Tuesday.
Significant snow accumulation will begin around 2000 feet today before
snow levels rise briefly this evening. Snow levels will then fall
to the valley floors Monday night. Snow will continue to
accumulate through Tuesday. Eventually, snow will taper off late
Tuesday evening. More snow will probably impact the Mt Shasta
region and Klamath Mountains late Wednesday and Wednesday night.

* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 2500 feet, heavy snow
expected. Additional snow accumulations of 8 to 15 inches.
Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory
between 2000 and 2500 feet, snow expected. Total snow
accumulations of 2 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...The winter storm warning covers elevations above 2500
feet in eastern Curry County and Josephine County, including
Oregon Caves. The winter weather advisory covers elevations
between generally 2000 and 2500 feet, including the Interstate
5 passes north of Grants Pass.

* WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to 10 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to slick and snow
covered roads, and may impact the morning commute. Periods of
gusty winds may produce lower visibilities due to blowing and
drifting snow.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions.

* If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets,
food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you.

* The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

* A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is
imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take
protective action now.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET
